result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Ward, Jermar D

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on April 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Babe requests another sentencing hearing for the Defendant to deal with his tax intercept issues, so that he can get his Driver's License, so that he can take advantage of the State's offer to amend to a ticket. State has no objection. Court resets. Bail remains as fixed  Calendar call scheduled for April 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court with Attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #14CT1334.  Calendar call scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court will quash stayed capias. Atty Babe requests jury trial date for the Defendant to pay tickets and obtain drivers license. Court sets jury trial date for 14CT1334, other cases to follow.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 10:5 a.m. Attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe in court.   Defendant Jermar D Ward did not appear.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Babe does not know why Defendant does not appear today.    Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on June 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court with Attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Babe requests an adjournment so Defendant can pay off fines and re-instate his driver's license.  Court sets case #14CT1334 for jury status and jury trial.   Bail remains as fixed.  This case to go in on jury status date with Case #14CT1334.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 03-14-2016 10:00 am
Hearing at 03-11-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court with Attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Babe reqeusts an adjourned date so she can review discovery and so Defendant can obtain his driver's license.  Court adjourns,   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Attorney Babe
Hearing at 12-11-2015 09:30 am
Atty Babe (Lakeland Law Firm) has been appointment. Defendant to pay: $50/month commencing 12/01/15.
Hearing at 12-11-2015 09:30 am

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jermar D Ward in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he did not qualify for public defender representation.  State has offer to amend if Defendant can obtain his driver's license.  Defendant requests a court appointed attorney.  Court cancels jury trial for Tuesday, November 10, 2015.  Court reviews petition for appointment of counsel submitted by Defendant.  Court grants Defendant's request and orders appointment of counsel for Defendant.  Defendant to pay for such counsel at rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 12/1/15 until paid in full.  Court sets review date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 11-05-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he wishes to seek counsel.  Court adjourns.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states that he is not able to get license until next year. Court sets for jury trial and jury trial status on 14CT1334.  Other cases to tag along. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he is still trying to obtain his driver's license.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Jermar D Ward in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
